intro: Stachytarpheta prismatica, commonly known as the purpletop verbena, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean and parts of Central America. It is characterized by its striking violet to purple flowers that bloom in whorled clusters along the stems. The plant has lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in fine hairs, giving it a slightly fuzzy appearance. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardens. Stachytarpheta prismatica is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
